1. Open a terminal and type `visudo`. This command opens the sudoers file in a safe-to-edit mode using the default text editor (usually `vi` or `nano`).

   ```
   username ALL=(ALL:ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL
   ```

5. Save and exit the editor. In `vi`, you can do this by typing `:wq` and pressing Enter. In `nano`, press `Ctrl+X`, then `Y`, and finally `Enter`.
